title: Serif ans Sans version
content:
Hey all,

I am doing some research on fonts that exist in a serif and a sans version.  
One example would be foundry's Foundry Form that exists as Foundry Form Sans and Foundry Form Serif.  
Are there any other typefaces you can think of that exist in both versions?

Next to that i would love to hear about morphing typefaces.  
I guess im just diving into the world of flexible/dynamic type.  
Anyone who can introduce me to that world and open the door for me?

Thanx!
author: mr_ampersand

comments.content: Check out this FontList of super families: [http://www.fontshop.com/fontlist/super\_families/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150202004102/http:/www.fontshop.com/fontlist/super_families/ "http://www.fontshop.com/fontlist/super\_families/") . You'll find that some of these go even further than just a sans and serif version.
